normalised: Did you know that India only has one time zone, I-S-T (Indian Standard Time), which is G-M-T plus five thirty? So, if it is two P-M in Delhi, it is not the same time in London or New York. For instance, two zero zero P-M I-S-T would be nine thirty A-M in London (G-M-T) and four zero zero A-M in New York (E-S-T). Even though India spans a wide longitude, they decided against multiple time zones to avoid confusion and keep things simple. Remember to adjust your clock when calling friends in the U-S at ten zero zero P-M I-S-T, because it is actually morning there!
